cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest – expected to cross central and western Cuba Monday, enter the Florida Straits, and then track north-northwestward along/near the west coast of Florida toward the Tampa Bay–Big Bend region Tuesday night–Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coastline near or just north of Tampa Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch currently only for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: No Florida west-coast warnings in effect yet; warnings confined to Jamaica and portions of Cuba/Haiti
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Keys northward through the Big Bend
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible: 35% cumulative chance of ≥34-kt winds with peak onset probability of 24% around 70 h (early Wednesday). Chance of ≥50-kt winds is low (8%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge currently expected (<3 ft); official surge forecast for west-central Florida not yet issued.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches widespread with localized amounts up to 6 inches Monday–Wednesday could produce isolated flash or urban flooding in the Tampa Bay area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and hazardous marine conditions beginning late Tuesday.
